channel.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
channel.description:
Hey guys, my ISP recently had a major upgrade and they gave the choice of a new router for a small side fee which would provide better access to the Internet. I accepted it, but, now I can't portforward. I used Google, Portforward.com but none of them provide me with a guide for GIGASET SE568. PortForward.com has a guide for SE567 but not for SE568. [I know, terrible luck, huh? :P] Anyone who has this router and knows how to PF it, please tell me here.
NOTE: This is not a MOPARSCAPE related question. Portforwarding isn't neccesarily related to Moparscape.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

It’s alright guys, thanks for the replies.
I changed routers since I had a WRTG something Linksys, which is obviously far simpler.

Read full topic

@runescape3dude
I followed your saying and I tried DMZ, yet my ports aren’t open.

item.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
item.dc:creator: @runescape3dude runescape3dude
item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:11, topic:297395”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=393425.msg2928407#msg2928407 date=1251141847]
just put your computer into a DMZ so you wont need to open any more ports.
[/quote]
Dude, stop kidding your self. That can allow easy access for viruses etc, it’s usually used for testing stuff.

Setup a static IP, and redirect to that IP. Use TCP/UDP for most ports. Service by name depends on what you’re forwarding. Try HTTP?

Wouldn’t the guide for the previous router version be very close/the same?

I have a static IP set up, I’m currently using it. Should I use TCP and UDP? Or only one?
If I use HTTP I have to put the ports as 80 and 80?

Thanks for the replies guys.[/quote]
DMZ + A machine being used as a custom firewall > Standard Router

Read full topic

item.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

HTTP is TCP…

Read full topic

item.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

Oh alright.
But suppose I use port 80 for TCP and I make another one with UDP and put ports 80 > it doesn’t allow that.

Read full topic

item.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
item.dc:creator: @the_bank the bank
item.description:
@the_bank wrote:

[quote=“akl, post:11, topic:297395”][quote author=runescape3dude link=topic=393425.msg2928407#msg2928407 date=1251141847]
just put your computer into a DMZ so you wont need to open any more ports.
[/quote]
Dude, stop kidding your self. That can allow easy access for viruses etc, it’s usually used for testing stuff.

Setup a static IP, and redirect to that IP. Use TCP/UDP for most ports. Service by name depends on what you’re forwarding. Try HTTP?

Wouldn’t the guide for the previous router version be very close/the same?

I have a static IP set up, I’m currently using it. Should I use TCP and UDP? Or only one?
If I use HTTP I have to put the ports as 80 and 80?

Thanks for the replies guys.[/quote]Depends on what your forwarding. Usually you want to use BOTH. As for service by name, it’s not needed if you use protocol, hence the big “OR”.

Read full topic

item.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
item.dc:creator: @akl akl
item.description:
@akl wrote:

I’m on the control panel but this router isn’t very obvious tbh.
You have to do DHCP, and everything.
Most have a Pf option, this one doesn’t.

K Unhandled, I found it.
but what settings do I use?
I heard the settings differ from each router, not sure.
Here’s a snap:

wup5qh.jpg782×329

[br][br][size=1]Posted on: 24-08-2009, 14:32:58[/size][hr]Should these be the settings?:

Service by name: HTTP
The options are: Telnet, FTP, HTTP, SNMP, SMTP, PPT, DOMAIN

Protocol options: TCP, UDP, ICMP, GRE

What should the ports be?

Redirect selected protocol/service to this router
OR
Redirect selected protocol/service to IP address

Any sort of help will be appreciated.

Read full topic

item.title: Siemens Gigaset SE568 Help
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I never understood why people need a guide to set up port forwarding…It should be perfectly obvious from the router’s control panel, either you can or can’t do it.

Read full topic
